gov.usgs.anss.edge

Class MasterBlock

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.usgs.anss.edge.MasterBlock

  • public final class MasterBlock
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a master block from the .idx file. It maintains the data and can convert to/from the on disk structure. This class is mostly used by the IndexFile class to manipulate and keep the MasterBlocks allocated within an .idx file. The translation between this block and its persistent storage on disk are made in this file. 
     The physical form is :
 12 Character seedname
 Short starting index block
 Short last index block
 ...
 repeat 32 times.

        public MasterBlock(int ib,
                   IndexFile ifl,
                   boolean isNew)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Creates a new instance of MasterBlock for the give block, IndexFile
        Parameters:
        ib - Block number in raw file for this master block
        ifl - the IndexFile object in which this master block exists
        isNew - if true, this is a newly allocated master block, if false, pre-existing
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if read or write fails while creating the block

      • getFirstIndexBlock

        public int getFirstIndexBlock(java.lang.StringBuilder name)
                       throws IllegalSeednameException
        Find this channel in the block, if found return its index block number,
        Parameters:
        name - Name to look for
        Returns:
        -1 if cannot be added (master block is full) or index to this channel
        Throws:
        IllegalSeednameException - if the name input does not pass MasterBlock.checkSeedName()

      • addIndexBlock

        public int addIndexBlock(java.lang.StringBuilder name,
                         int index)
                  throws java.io.IOException,
                         IllegalSeednameException
        Try to add this name to this master block. If successful, last index block is updated and disk persistent storage is updated as well. If it is not found, -1 is returned indicating the channel is not in this master block and the end of the channels were not found. If the end of the masterblocks is reached (a blank name indicates this), add this as a new channel to that master block.
        Parameters:
        name - Name to add to add
        index - index block
        Returns:
        -1 if cannot be added (master block is full) or index to this channel
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if write of master block fails.
        IllegalSeednameException - if the name input does not pass MasterBlock.checkSeedName()

      • findChannel

        public int findChannel(java.lang.StringBuilder name)
        Find this channel in this master block
        Parameters:
        name - The seed channel name (12 character)
        Returns:
        -1 if not found. The channel number in this MasterBlock, if found

      • setLastIndex

        public int setLastIndex(java.lang.StringBuilder name,
                        int blk)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        IllegalSeednameException
        set a new last index block number for this named channel
        Parameters:
        name - The seed name of the channel
        blk - The block number of the last index.
        Returns:
        -1 if channel not in this iblk, else offset in this block of channel
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if write of block is not successful
        IllegalSeednameException - if name does not pass checkSeedName()

        public final void updateBlock2()
                        throws java.io.IOException

        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if write fails

      • checkSeedName

        public static void checkSeedName(java.lang.String name)
                          throws IllegalSeednameException
        static method that insures a seedname makes some sense. 1) Name is 12 characters long nnssssscccll. 2) All characters are characters, digits, spaces, question marks or dashes 3) Network code contain blanks 4) Station code must be at least 3 characters long 5) Channel codes must be characters in first two places
        Parameters:
        name - A seed string to check
        Throws:
        IllegalSeednameException - if any of the above rules are violated.

      • checkSeedName

        public static void checkSeedName(java.lang.StringBuilder name)
                          throws IllegalSeednameException
        static method that insures a seedname makes some sense. 1) Name is 12 characters long nnssssscccll. 2) All characters are characters, digits, spaces, question marks or dashes 3) Network code contain blanks 4) Station code must be at least 3 characters long 5) Channel codes must be characters in first two places
        Parameters:
        name - A seed string to check
        Throws:
        IllegalSeednameException - if any of the above rules are violated.
